pers.yujie.dashboard.config

Class RequestManagerConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • pers.yujie.dashboard.config.RequestManagerConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.Filter

    @Component
public class RequestManagerConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.Filter
    Utilises Spring Boot aspect-oriented programming (AOP) to validate requests and sign responses. The requests are intercepted in FilterConfig.
    For some unknown reasons, the RateLimiter API is still marked as unstable, and this class has disabled this warning.
    Since:
    19/01/2023
    See Also:
    Filter

      • applyRateLimiting

        private java.lang.Object applyRateLimiting(org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint joinPoint)
                                    throws java.lang.Throwable
        Apply rate limit to the pre-defined Pointcut. It will reject the requests, provided that they have exceeded the limitation.
        Parameters:
        joinPoint - AOP ProceedingJoinPoint
        Returns:
        proceed the original requests to corresponding controllers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - exception raised by the ProceedingJoinPoint.proceed().

      • applyEncryptionCheck

        public java.lang.Object applyEncryptionCheck(org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint joinPoint)
                                      throws java.lang.Throwable
        Check whether the requests come from trusted sources. It will reject the requests, provided that they fail to pass the RSA encryption. The encryption data should be contained in the 'Authorization' header and encrypted by the given public key.
        Parameters:
        joinPoint - AOP ProceedingJoinPoint
        Returns:
        proceed the original requests to corresponding controllers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - exception raised by the ProceedingJoinPoint.proceed().
        See Also:
        EncryptUtil

      • doFilter

        public void doFilter(javax.servlet.ServletRequest servletRequest,
                     javax.servlet.ServletResponse servletResponse,
                     javax.servlet.FilterChain filterChain)
              throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Sign the responses and set Content Security Policy (CSP) headers for modern browsers.
        Specified by:
        doFilter in interface javax.servlet.Filter
        Parameters:
        servletRequest - http request
        servletResponse - http response
        filterChain - filter all controllers
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - exception raised by FilterChain.doFilter(ServletRequest, ServletResponse)
        java.io.IOException - exception raised by FilterChain.doFilter(ServletRequest, ServletResponse)
        See Also:
